title: Mechanical energy of planet vs star-planet system

content.question: A planet is in an elliptical orbit around a star, as shown above. Which of the following best represents the mechanical energy Eplanet of just the planet and the mechanical energy Estar-planet of the star-planet system as functions of time for one complete orbit?

choices.label: Two figures are shown. On the left, The E-sub-planet graph has a straight horizontal line about halfway up the positive y-axis. On the right, the E-sub star planet graph has a straight horizontal line at the bottom of the negative y-axis.

Two graphs. The first graph plots E subscript planet against Time. The graph plots a horizontal line above the horizontal axis. The second graph plots E subscript star-planet against Time. The graph plots a downward-facing curve below the horizontal axis.

Two graphs. The first graph plots E subscript planet against Time. The graph plots a downward-facing curve above the horizontal axis. The second graph plots E subscript star-planet against Time. The graph plots a horizontal line below the horizontal axis.

The E-sub-planet graph has a concave down curve that starts about a third of the way up the positive y-axis, rises to a maximum value about halfway along the horizontal axis, and back down to that starting value. The maximum value is near the top of the positive y-axis. The E-sub-star-planet graph has a concave down curve that starts at the bottom of the negative y-axis, rises to a maximum value about halfway along the horizontal axis, and drops back down to that starting value. The maximum value is about halfway down the negative y-axis.

content.answer: Two graphs. The first graph plots E subscript planet against Time. The graph plots a downward-facing curve above the horizontal axis. The second graph plots E subscript star-planet against Time. The graph plots a horizontal line below the horizontal axis.
